##### Time-Series Plots

These time-series plots show the trends over time *before* the removal of any potentially spurious data points and the balancing of the panels.  They are presented for that very purpose, identification of possibly spurious data points.

###### Case Sites

```{r template_time_series_plot_case, echo = FALSE, cache = FALSE, results = 'hide' eval = TRUE}
closed_ts_plot(df            = df_site_measure,
               indicator     = 'measure',
               sub.indicator = 'submeasure',
               steps         = TRUE,
               theme         = theme_bw(),
               tidy          = FALSE,
               facet         = FALSE,
               sites         = c('Bishop Auckland', 'Hartlepool', 'Hemel Hempstead', 'Newark', 'Rochdale'),
               legend        = TRUE)
```

###### Control Sites

```{r template_time_series_plot_control, echo = FALSE, cache = FALSE, results = 'hide', eval = TRUE}

               indicator     = 'measure',
               sub.indicator = 'submeasure',

               theme         = theme_bw(),
               tidy          = FALSE,
               facet         = FALSE,
               sites         = c('Salford', 'Scarborough', 'Whitehaven',
                                 'Blackburn', 'Grimsby', 'Wigan',

                                 'Carlisle', 'Salisbury', 'Southport',

```

##### Model 1
`Case Site    : Individual`\
`Control Site : None`\
`Panel        : ED`\
`Model        : observations ~ season + time + closure + nhs111 + ambulance.divert + other.centre`\

```{r template_model1, echo = FALSE, cache = FALSE, results = 'markup', eval = TRUE}
template.any$model1.ts.plot
template.any$model1.forest$forest
template.any$model1.panelar.all$coef[3:8] %>% kable(caption = template.any$model1.panelar.all$caption)
```
